name: MS15-018 Microsoft Internet Explorer 10 and 11 Cross-Domain JavaScript Injection
author: David Leo
filedescriptor
joev <joev@metasploit.com>
sinn3r <sinn3r@metasploit.com>
description:
This module exploits a universal cross-site scripting (UXSS) vulnerability found in Internet
          Explorer 10 and 11. By default, you will steal the cookie from TARGET_URI (which cannot
          have X-Frame-Options or it will fail). You can also have your own custom JavaScript
          by setting the CUSTOMJS option. Lastly, you might need to configure the URIHOST option if
          you are behind NAT.

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: VERBOSE
options.description: Enable detailed status messages

options.name: SRVHOST
options.description: The local host or network interface to listen on. This must be an address on the local machine or 0.0.0.0 to listen on all addresses.

options.name: SRVPORT
options.description: The local port to listen on.

options.name: ListenerComm
options.description: The specific communication channel to use for this service

options.name: SSL
options.description: Negotiate SSL for incoming connections

options.name: SSLCert
options.description: Path to a custom SSL certificate (default is randomly generated)

options.name: SSLCompression
options.description: Enable SSL/TLS-level compression

options.name: SSLCipher
options.description: String for SSL cipher spec - "DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA" or "ADH"

options.name: TCP::max_send_size
options.description: Maximum tcp segment size.  (0 = disable)

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: URIPATH
options.description: The URI to use for this exploit (default is random)

options.name: HTTP::no_cache
options.description: Disallow the browser to cache HTTP content

options.name: HTTP::chunked
options.description: Enable chunking of HTTP responses via "Transfer-Encoding: chunked"

options.name: HTTP::header_folding
options.description: Enable folding of HTTP headers

options.name: HTTP::junk_headers
options.description: Enable insertion of random junk HTTP headers

options.name: HTTP::compression
options.description: Enable compression of HTTP responses via content encoding (Accepted: none, gzip, deflate)

options.name: HTTP::server_name
options.description: Configures the Server header of all outgoing replies

options.name: URIHOST
options.description: Host to use in URI (useful for tunnels)

options.name: URIPORT
options.description: Port to use in URI (useful for tunnels)

options.name: SendRobots
options.description: Return a robots.txt file if asked for one

options.name: TARGET_URI
options.description: The URL for the target iframe

options.name: CUSTOMJS
options.description: Custom JavaScript
